Class GameEntity

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameEntity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Actor, Ground, Item
public abstract class GameEntity extends Object
Base class for all objects that can exist in the game. This version supports: - Multiple status effects of any type (e.g., multiple poisons). - Static abilities via Enums. Example: An actor may have several status effects (burning, poisoned, stunned, etc.) by implementing interfaces, abilities such as CAN_BE_BURNED.

      Removes a status effect from this entity.
      Parameters:
      status - the status effect to remove
      Returns:
      true if the status was present and removed, false otherwise

    • statuses

      public List<Status> statuses()
      Returns an unmodifiable list of all current statuses.
      Returns:
      a list of statuses, may be empty if none are present

    • statusesOf

      public <T extends Status> List<T> statusesOf(Class<T> type)
      Returns a list of all statuses of the specified type.
      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • hasStatus

      public boolean hasStatus(Class<? extends Status> type)
      Checks whether this entity currently has at least one status of the specified type.
      Parameters:
      type - the class type of the status to check for
      Returns:
      true if at least one status of the given type is present, false otherwise

    • tickStatuses

      public void tickStatuses(Location location)
      Ticks all status effects attached to this entity. For each status, calls its tick() method. If a status is no longer active after ticking, it is removed from the entity.
